title: 114_s278
content: The "Citizen Empowerment Act" may be cited as the official title. Part III of title 5, United States Code, is amended by adding a new chapter 79A for services to members of the public. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" establishes procedures for in-person and telephonic interactions by executive branch employees regarding possible violations of federal statutes or regulations. It defines terms such as "covered interaction" and "telephonic" for clarity. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" defines the term 'State' as including all States, the District of Columbia, and U.S. territories. It also clarifies 'telephonic' as communication via telephone or similar electronic devices. The Act allows individuals to record interactions with executive branch employees at their own expense. Employees can also record interactions after informing the individual and provide a transcript upon request. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" requires Executive agency employees to provide verbal or written notice of an individual's rights before or at the start of an interaction. Separate notifications are needed for different violations. The Act also applies to official representatives or those with power of attorney. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" allows official representatives or those with power of attorney to make audio recordings and receive transcripts of covered interactions with Executive agency employees. They must receive the same notice as the individual and have the same rights regarding recordings. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" grants individuals the right to audio recordings and transcripts of interactions with Executive agency employees. These recordings are the property of the individual, and there is no private right of action. Exceptions include classified information, public safety, and criminal investigations. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" allows individuals to record interactions with Executive agency employees, with exceptions for classified information, public safety, and ongoing criminal investigations. Employees must notify individuals if an exception applies. This section supersedes certain laws related to recording covered interactions. This section supersedes certain laws related to recording covered interactions and mandates disciplinary action for Executive agency employees who violate it. The section mandates disciplinary action for Executive agency employees who violate laws related to recording covered interactions and provides services to members of the public.
